columns.Description: Unique identifier for each video. Used as a primary key to distinguish one video from another.
Stores the date and time when the video was published on YouTube.
Represents the unique identifier of the YouTube channel that uploaded the video. Establishes a relationship between videos and channels.
The name of the YouTube channel that uploaded the video.
This field stores the title of the video. It provides a concise description of the video's content.
The description field contains a more detailed textual description of the video's content. It provides additional context to viewers.
Tags are keywords or phrases associated with the video. They help categorize and search for videos by topic or content.
This field records the number of times the video has been viewed. It's an important metric for measuring a video's popularity.
The number of likes received by the video. Likes indicate viewer approval and engagement with the content.
This field may be found in older YouTube videos. It was used to track how many users added the video to their 'Favorites.'
This field counts both comments and replies on the video. It reflects the level of interaction and engagement with viewers.
Duration is the length of the video, typically in hours, minutes, and seconds. It provides information about the video's length.
This field indicates the video's dimension and is usually '2D' for standard videos.
The resolution or quality of the video, whether it's in standard definition (SD) or high definition (HD).
These categories represent the primary topics or themes of the video. They help classify videos by subject matter.
This field indicates whether the video has closed captions or subtitles. If 'true,' it means the video includes captioning.
A boolean field that shows whether the video has licensed content. If 'true,' it means the video contains copyrighted material with the appropriate licenses.
